front.title: An IPv6 Routing Header for Source Routes with RPL

abstract.t: In Low power and Lossy Networks (LLNs), memory constraints on routersmay limit them to maintaining at most a few routes. In someconfigurations, it is necessary to use these memory constrainedrouters to deliver datagrams to nodes within the LLN. The Routingfor Low Power and Lossy Networks (RPL) protocol can be used in somedeployments to store most, if not all, routes on one (e.g. theDirected Acyclic Graph (DAG) root) or few routers and forward theIPv6 datagram using a source routing technique to avoid large routingtables on memory constrained routers. This document specifies a newIPv6 Routing header type for delivering datagrams within a RPLdomain.
